remarks.format:
## Remarks This helper class is designed to assist with writing authenticated mobile Web sites. The class objects provide mobile device-compatible versions of the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.Security.FormsAuthentication> class methods, <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileFormsAuthentication.RedirectFromLoginPage%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileFormsAuthentication.SignOut%2A>. For more information on securing your Web application, see [Basic Security Practices for Web Applications](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example shows a login.aspx page. The authentication is validated using the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.ValidateUser%2A> function. The <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership> class relies on membership providers to communicate with a data source.

## Remarks The methods create an encrypted string from the authentication cookie and append it to the redirecting URL of the originating request. A client-side redirect is then issued for that URL. This can be used to work around the limitations of certain mobile devices that either do not support cookies, or support cookies that are too small for storing authentication information in a secure manner.
